meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: THIS AGAIN
Wired.com refuses to publish full investigation into Jonah Lehrer's misdeeds that reveals evidence of plagiarism, dodgy quotes, and factual inaccuracies.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NCbI13&via=Digg&text=Wired.com's Big Problem

div.div: INSTAPORN
Tens of thousands of users are creating X-rated ‘Instaporn’ with popular photo app.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Px6kaY&via=Digg&text=The Dark Side Of Instagram

div.div: #EASTWOODING

div.a: The Long History Of Americans Debating Empty Chairs

div.div: It turns out that the history of debating empty chairs is a rich one, stretching back to at least 1924 when Progressive* vice-presidential nominee Burton K. Wheeler took a stab at an invisible President Calvin Coolidge.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NBeX90&via=Digg&text=The Long History Of Americans Debating Empty Chairs

div.div: WE DID NOT

div.a: Can You Make It Through This Post Without Crying?

div.div: Here is a challenge: Make it all the way through this post without crying. You have to read the whole post!

li.div: Evil geniuses at @buzzfeed will make you cry by end of this post. I only made it to No. 4 #somuchsad buzzfeed.com/lilyboo/thing...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RrMDRx&via=Digg&text=Can You Make It Through This Post Without Crying?

div.div: GRAPHIC AND VERY SAD

div.a: Russian Powerlifter Drops 400 Pounds On His Chest, Reportedly Dies

div.div: Be warned: What happened to poor Igor Golushkin in this video is not for the squeamish.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PFTRWY&via=Digg&text=Russian Powerlifter Drops 400 Pounds On His Chest, Reportedly Dies

div.div: AMAZING TUMBLRS
These are hilarious. That is all.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Km8Wpa&via=Digg&text=Texts From Superheroes

div.div: EISENHOWER WARNED US, DIDN'T HE?

div.a: In Search Of The Living, Purring, Singing Heart Of The Online Cat-Industrial Complex

div.div: In which Wired dives down the rabbit hole to find the source of cat videos on the internet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PEuo0j&via=Digg&text=In Search Of The Living, Purring, Singing Heart Of The Online Cat-Industrial Complex

div.div: IT ALL MAKES SENSE NOW

div.a: Gene That Makes Men Mad Makes Women Happy

div.div: A gene which has been linked to aggression in men appears to make women happy, according to a US study.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T2hecx&via=Digg&text=Gene That Makes Men Mad Makes Women Happy

div.div: BABY DOLPHINS?!

div.a: What Do Hurricanes Mean For Dolphins?

div.div: Hurricanes are typically associated with loss of life, loss of property, and economic devastation. Hurricane Katrina, which blew through the gulf coast in summer 2005, brought all those things and more. It also brought lots of baby dolphins.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PF3Rjc&via=Digg&text=What Do Hurricanes Mean For Dolphins?

div.div: FACT OR FICTION

div.a: Does Tapping A Soda Can Prevent It From Exploding With Foam?

div.div: They say you can’t un-break what’s broken, un-see what you’ve seen or put the toothpaste back in the tube. But can you un-shake a can of soda?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PBu0tO&via=Digg&text=Does Tapping A Soda Can Prevent It From Exploding With Foam?

div.div: BIG BROTHER

div.a: Software Meant To Fight Crime Is Used To Spy On Dissidents

div.div: Morgan Marquis-Boire works as a Google engineer and Bill Marczak is earning a Ph.D. in computer science. But this summer, the two men have been moonlighting as detectives, chasing an elusive surveillance tool from Bahrain across five continents.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T1Ur0k&via=Digg&text=Software Meant To Fight Crime Is Used To Spy On Dissidents

div.div: CHARTS

div.a: Which State Has The Fewest People On Health Insurance?

div.div: Where in America do the fewest people have health insurance?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PBl1hR&via=Digg&text=Which State Has The Fewest People On Health Insurance?

div.div: SESAME STREET MYSTERIES

div.a: Why Was 34,969 Count Von Count's Magic Number?

div.div: It's R.I.P. to Jerry Nelson, the puppeteer behind Sesame Street's resident number expert Count von Count. The Count loved all numbers, but 34,969 in particular. Why?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PCnTuV&via=Digg&text=Why Was 34,969 Count Von Count's Magic Number?

div.div: TWITTER: LITERALLY FASTER THAN AN EARTHQUAKE

div.a: The USGS First Learned About The Philippines Earthquake From Twitter

div.div: Today, the USGS' Twitter Earthquake Dispatch service beat its own seismometers in detecting the massive quake that struck of the Philippines this morning.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O9j9Z3&via=Digg&text=The USGS First Learned About The Philippines Earthquake From Twitter

div.div: APPLE

div.a: What An iPhone 5 Probably Looks Like Next To An iPhone 4

div.div: A French gadget site has a bunch of pics of the purported iPhone 5.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PEZhfc&via=Digg&text=What An iPhone 5 Probably Looks Like Next To An iPhone 4

div.div: CINEMATOGRAPHY

div.a: The Visual Secret Behind Every Stanley Kubrick Movie

div.div: Much of Stanley Kubrick's work is built around one visual frame.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T2tIB5&via=Digg&text=The Visual Secret Behind Every Stanley Kubrick Movie

div.div: YOU CAN'T TAKE IT WITH YOU

div.a: What Happens To Your Facebook Account When You Die?

div.div: What will happen to your Facebook account after you are gone? Dealing with digital assets after someone dies is becoming a challenge for families and the legal system alike.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OGCRyj&via=Digg&text=What Happens To Your Facebook Account When You Die?

div.div: OBL RAID

div.a: What Was The Cover Story If Bin Laden Raid Went Bad?

div.div: Before SEAL Team 6 was sent into Pakistan to kill Osama bin Laden, the troops were given a cover story, in case the mission went south.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PvhGwr&via=Digg&text=What Was The Cover Story If Bin Laden Raid Went Bad?

div.div: PHOTOSHOP HISTORY

div.a: What If The 1906 San Francisco Earthquake Happened Today?

div.div: Photographer Shawn Clover finds the exact spot where photos from the 1906 earthquake were taken and blends them with the city as it is today.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NATsF6&via=Digg&text=What If The 1906 San Francisco Earthquake Happened Today?

div.div: MAN'S BEST FRIEND

div.a: Why Dogs Really Do Feel Your Pain

div.div: Dogs may empathize with humans more than any other animal, including humans themselves, several new studies suggest.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PEFjHb&via=Digg&text=Why Dogs Really Do Feel Your Pain

div.div: HULK SMASH EXERCISE

div.a: Researchers Find 'Hulk' Gene That Promotes Muscle Growth

div.div: In wonderful news for vain but lazy people everywhere, Australian scientists think they have found one of the molecular keys to muscle growth — a protein that promotes weight and muscle mass gain without any of the pesky exercise.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PFYn7V&via=Digg&text=Researchers Find 'Hulk' Gene That Promotes Muscle Growth

div.div: HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE? AND WHY?!
theglobeandmail.com - via @alexweprin
Police are on the hunt for a sticky-fingered thief after millions of dollars of maple syrup vanished from a Quebec warehouse.

li.div: A real-life "Ocean's 11," except the thieves stole maple syrup instead of money. Oh Canada: theglobeandmail.com/news/n...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PCpRWr&via=Digg&text=$30 Million Of Maple Syrup Stolen

div.div: APPLE VS. SAMSUNG

The much bigger questions raised by this case are whether all Apple’s innovations should have been granted a patent in the first place; and the degree to which technology stalwarts and start-ups alike should be able to base their designs on the breakthroughs of others.

li.div: "Not every innovation deserves a patent. Not every copycat deserves punishment", says @TheEconomist on Apple Vs Samsung economist.com/node/21561888

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QDXTPA&via=Digg&text=iPhone, uCopy, iSue
